title: Excess charge distribution on two spheres

content.question: Two uncharged conducting spheres on insulating stands are in contact when a positively charged rod is brought near but does not touch them, as shown in the figure above. The right sphere is then moved far to the right, and finally the rod is removed. Which of the following best shows the final distribution of excess charges, if any, on the spheres?

choices.label: The figure presents an uncharged sphere.
The figure presents a sphere with 6 negative charges.
The figure presents a sphere with 6 negative charges.
The figure presents a sphere with 6 positive charges.

content.answer: The figure presents a sphere with 6 negative charges.
